title: Check out this Bulls/Bears jersey mashup
text:
Not even this Bulls jersey mashup could save the Bears’ season, but it’s still cool to look at.
Bleacher Report released these NBA/NFL jersey mashups on Friday, and the Chicago jersey is pretty awesome.
Sick!!! Via @BleacherReport pic.twitter.com/JewPDWIGz4
— Anthony Garcia (@A_Garcia1990) October 23, 2015
Even Alshon Jeffery, the Bears player featured in the image, is on board:
Dope https://t.co/e0kLlXsLsu
— Alshon Jeffery (@TeamJeffery_) October 23, 2015
These aren’t bad either:
This is incredible » https://t.co/6gwKydEziX (H/T @lucymatz ) pic.twitter.com/8YnUCaxku0
— Kris Koivisto (@KrisKoivisto) October 23, 2015
The New England Celtics! pic.twitter.com/gEk0O9ZHHp
— Forever Green™ (@ForeverGreen_) October 23, 2015
For some reason, Aaron Rodgers looks a lot less intimidating in a Bucks uniform.
Aaron Rodgers in the Packers x Bucks mashup pic.twitter.com/cGWKHsZnrH
— Alex Syse (@alexsyse) October 23, 2015
Check out the complete collection here .
The Bears are off this weekend and will return to action Week 8 against Minnesota.
The Bulls kick off their season Tuesday against the Cavaliers.
See where Bulls players landed in ESPN’s player rankings: Start Slideshow » Bleacher Report created these NBA/NFL mashup uniforms
Detroit Pistons guard Spencer Dinwiddie, left, and Chicago Bulls guard E'Twaun Moore chase the ball during the second half of an NBA preseason basketball game on Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015, in Chicago. The Pistons won 114-91. (AP Photo/Nam Y. Huh)
From ESPN: What Butler did last season is incredibly difficult. He transmogrified from a defense-first wing with solid offensive skills limited to a low-volume arsenal of open jumpers and attacks off the dribble, to a full-service 2-guard and top-flight shot maker. | AP Photo/David Zalubowski
